org.wicketstuff.security.checks

Class AlwaysGrantedSecurityCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wicketstuff.security.checks.AbstractSecurityCheck
      • org.wicketstuff.security.checks.AlwaysGrantedSecurityCheck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, ISecurityCheck

    public class AlwaysGrantedSecurityCheck
extends AbstractSecurityCheck
    A securitycheck that always grants the permission to the user. Subclasses may overwrite isAuthenticated() to enforce a logged in user.
    Author:
    marrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • isActionAuthorized

        public boolean isActionAuthorized(WaspAction action)
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityCheck
        Checks if there are sufficient rights to perform the desired action(s). Note that we don't ask what needs to have these rights, the implementation will decide if it checks the class, component, model or whatever they like.
        Parameters:
        action - the action(s) like render or enable.
        Returns:
        true if there are sufficient rights, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ISecurityCheck.isActionAuthorized(org.wicketstuff.security.actions.WaspAction)

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityCheck
        Checks if there is an authenticated user available. If not a page might decide to redirect to a login page instead. other components won't use this ordinarily.
        Returns:
        true if an authenticated user is available, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ISecurityCheck.isAuthenticated()
